history.content:
I don't think the class itself would be very useful for ML since it mainly teaches things like "how does a transistor work?", "what are some of the non-idealities when dealing with circuits?", and "how are flip-flops/adders/SRAM implemented?". (See: http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~eecs151/fa19/)

The lab portion however would probably be useful since FPGAs and ASICs do have ML applications and can be used to build highly optimized systems.

I’m interested in the ML as I’ve taken 189 and stat 140 etc (the mathy portions of it at least), and I was curious at to see whether taking EECS 151 would be a useful course? I’m taking 61C and the circuit stuff is interested (it’s hard but it’s actually pretty cool) and I was curious about learning more. I hear 151 is a high workload class so I wanted to know and I hear it’s a extremely recruitable course because it’s super industry useful but is that in hardware only or in SWE overall? Also would it be good for be good in SWE and ML balanced here or take more purely of one or the other? 

Thanks!
history.subject: ML EECS 151
